home.whoami: I'm studying ICT engineering at Oulu University of Applied Sciences, with a focus on software development and cloud tech. Before I got into IT, I spent over five years doing industrial work - welding and winding transformers and inductors. That background taught me the value of getting things right the first time and building things that actually work. I bring that same approach to my projects now.
home.whatido:
I build web apps and backend systems that don't need constant fixing. I'm drawn to self-hosted services and automation - the kind of stuff that runs quietly in the background and just works. If I can automate something or run it on my own hardware, I probably will. Coffee helps with this process.

I also mess around with electronics. Soldering, wiring, programming ESP32s and Raspberry Pis. I like the challenge of connecting hardware and software into actually useful.
home.whatido_sub: Right now I'm looking for an internship, thesis position, or junior role where I can use these skills in a real environment and keep learning.
home.projects: In my free time I like building my own projects on <1>GitHub</1>. It's the easiest way for me to pick up new things and keep my skills moving forward. I try to get a little better every day.
home.projects_showcase: Here are a few projects I've built while learning and experimenting.
